page.title: 05ST.MARY'S CHURCH TATSFIELD
page.content: The church is built on the edge of a chalk escarpment 788 feet above sea level.It is half a mile above a section of the Pilgrim's Way that ran from Winchester to Canterbury.There is a low side window of a quatre foil shape in the South Wall through which the pilgrims could have taken communion.It is of 14thC.origin.The church is built of flint,chalk,firestone or upper greensand and a yellow stone peculiar to the district.It is very small,the nave measuring 43ft by 21ft.It dates back to 1075.St.Mary's is part of the group of Titsey and Limpsfield Chuches under the joint pastoral care of two priests.It is used by both Church of England and Roman Catholic congregations for worship and strong links have been established with the the United Reformed Church in the village.
